      • create

        public ConfigRevision create(ConfigFileData cff,
                    User user,
                    ConfigChannel channel)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             ValidatorException
        Creates a new config file using the information provided in the config file form.
        Parameters:
        cff - the config file from holding input data
        user - the logged in user.
        channel - the channel to create file in.
        Returns:
        the newest revision of the created config file..
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in the case of issues with content stream reading.
        ValidatorException - in the case of invalid data passed in.

      • update

        public ConfigRevision update(ConfigFileData form,
                    User user,
                    ConfigFile file)
                      throws ValidatorException
        Updates a config file depending on the data in the given configFileForm..
        Parameters:
        form - the ConfigFileData form containing the input data
        user - the logged in user.
        file - the config file to update.
        Returns:
        the create revision of the file.
        Throws:
        ValidatorException - in the case of invalid data.

      • createOrUpdate

        public ConfigRevision createOrUpdate(ConfigFileData form,
                            User user,
                            ConfigChannel cc)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     ValidatorException
        Creates Or Updates a config file depending on the data in the given configFileForm.. i.e. if a file with the given path exists, it updates the file with that path. Else it creates a new file of the path..
        Parameters:
        form - the config file form with the input data
        user - the logged in user.
        cc - the config channel of the file
        Returns:
        the create revision of the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in the case of issues due to parsing of contents.
        ValidatorException - in the case of invalid data.
